definitions: To be pampered or indulged to an excessive degree, often resulting in a demanding or ungrateful attitude.
To be damaged or impaired in quality, value, or effectiveness.
To become rotten or unfit for consumption (referring to food).
examples: The child will be spoiled if you give them everything they want.
The picnic will be spoiled if it rains.
The fruit will be spoiled if left out too long.
pastTenses: spoiled, spoiled, been spoiled, been spoiled, been spoiled
